boat.full_description: Built John Crossfield at Conway 1913 for local aristocrat, originally named 'Nama'. Name changed to 'Pacific Moon' and bought by Sidney Howard 1931 for voyage to pacific via Panama Canal with one companion 1931-2. Voyage written up by Howard in book 'Thames to Tahiti' ( pub1933). This includes good description of boat and previous history. Sold in Tahiti to Fredi Guthmann, a young Argentinian poet. Last record of her is in Vila, Vanatu, South Pacific in Nov 1932
boat.name: Pacific Moon
